creator: gillies@cs.ubc.ca
text:
THIS ERROR HAS EXISTED FOR TWO LONG YEARS !!  On PC platforms, Batik bombs off
if you unpack the package in a directory that has spaces in the pathname. 
Simple !  Fix it now !!

RE: batik 1.5 beta 5 - access denied exception?

    * Subject: RE: batik 1.5 beta 5 - access denied exception?
    * From: Prasanna Chetty <pchetty@cordys.com>
    * Date: Fri, 11 Apr 2003 08:32:22 +0200
    * To: 'Batik Users' <batik-users@xml.apache.org>

Hi Thomas E Deweese,
	I found the reason for the security exception which I was getting. 
The error was due to the problem with the name of the folder in which batik
was unzipped. Previously I used a folder name with spaces in-between. When I
renamed the folder and removed the spaces in the name, it is working fine.
Not getting any security exceptions. The problem was due the blank space in
the folder name.


Other details are given below..
I starter the rasterizer using the cmd 
java -jar batik-rasterizer.jar <svg file name >. The below is the version
details of my java
java version "1.4.0_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.0_01-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.0_01-b03, mixed mode)

Thanks
PC

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
I tried to reproduce this problem but I didn't have any problem:
    mkdir "test dir"
    cd "test dir"
    unzip ../batik-1.6.zip
    cd batik-1.6
    java -jar batik-rasterizer.jar samples/anne.svg

I even tried renaming the batik-1.6 directory to "batik 1.6" and it
still worked.  Feel free to reopen if you can provide a complete
set of commands that reproduce the problem for you.
